intro: Daphne feddei, commonly known as the Mexican daphne, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are glossy and oval-shaped, providing an attractive evergreen presence. Daphne feddei is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
